results.title: Fiona Hall. After 200 years
results.creator_credit: Kevin Ballantine, Brian Beaton and Izon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Visual instincts : Australian contemporary photographers”.
Two 30 minute episodes: 1. “Fiona Hall” Interview with Adelaide photographic artist, Fiona Hall. She discusses the aims and symbolism of her photo-collages and wide format photography. 2. “After 200 Years” A program on the Bicentennial project, co-ordinated by Penny Taylor, to commission twenty Australian photographers to document the diversity of Australian Aboriginal and Islander lifestyles in the ‘80s.

results.title: Finlandia
results.brief_description: A study of one of the greatest of contemporary composers, Jan Sibelius, born in Finland in 1865. Music played by the Helsinki Philharmonic Orchestra, includes excerpts from the Finlandia Suite, and the immortal Second Symphony in D Major.
results.description: A study of one of the greatest of contemporary composers, Jan Sibelius, born in Finland in 1865. Music played by the Helsinki Philharmonic Orchestra, includes excerpts from the Finlandia Suite, and the immortal Second Symphony in D Major.

results.title: Finland: fresh and original
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Visit unspoilt and unhurried Finland at the crossroads between East and West. Learn about the history of Finland and the Swedish influence on this country. Visit the Baltic port of Helsinki, Jyuaskyla and Finland’s second largest city at Tampere with it famous Lutheran cathedral. Step back in time in Turka with its handicraft museum and visit the Sibelius Museum. Travel north to the unspoilt wilderness of Lapland where the Lapps still tend herds of reindeer. Experience a sauna Finnish style.

results.title: Finland: a Karelian menu
results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
In Finland, sunlight is at a premium. The precious summer months are a time to celebrate and to harvest the home-grown produce so treasured by the Finns. Master Chef Reijo Rajala insists on using only the freshest ingredients in his cooking. He performs culinary magic with fish, vegetables and pastry dough.

results.title: Finland designs for living
results.brief_description: This film presents the beauty and variety of modern design on Finland. Shows designers at work at their drawing boards and in their studios creating by hand, what is later mass produced in the factory. Includes steel saucepans and cutlery, colorful weaving, the creation of pottery, its earliest stage as clay turning on a hand-wheel and beautiful glass being blown by skilled craftsmen working closely with the designer of the product.

results.title: Finite Elements
results.creator_credit: Atlas Computer Company and Royal College of Art (Great Britain)
results.brief_description: The training of engineering students in the technique of finite elements analysis has frequently presented certain difficulties. This film effectively shows the basis of the mathematical theory of the finite element method and then demonstrates its application to practical engineering problems.

results.title: Finian's rainbow
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Seven Artists, Joseph Landon and Francis Ford Coppola
results.brief_description: He wears a battered felt hat and a tattered old cardigan instead of a top hat and tails but one glimpse of those agile feet and you know he’s Fred Astaire. This exuberant, delightful film is well up to the honour of being his last musical. Based on the 1947 Broadway hit, Fred Astaire plays an Irish rogue with a whimsical economic theory: bury a stolen crock of leprechaun gold in the soil near Fort Knox and stand back! Mixed up in the shenanigans are his spirited daughter (Petula Clark) and love-struck leprechaun (Tommy Steele). Director Francis Ford Coppola skilfully updates the Broadway hit and lovingly show cases its most enduring treasure - the Burton Lane/E.Y. Harburg score. This charming film garnered an Oscar nomination for Musical Direction and includes well-known numbers such as ‘If this isn’t love’, ‘How are things in Glocca Morra?’, ‘Look to the rainbow’ and ‘Old devil moon’.

results.title: Fingers of gold
results.creator_credit: Kingcroft Productions and Banana Growers Federation
results.brief_description: Illustrates banana production and distribution in New South Wales. Provides information on such aspects as irrigation, protection from the cold, pests and fungus, harvesting, packing and controlled ripening.

results.title: Fingers and clay
results.brief_description: Part of the Outlook series. Pottery making as an artistic craft. Australian students and the Japanese master potter Shoji Hamada demonstrate techniques involved, and typical creative work is shown.
